sen.j: ｢七シコブチ｣とは、京都府と滋賀県を流れる安曇川流域固有の信仰神である｢しこぶち神｣を祀る主要な7社を指す。
sen.e: "Seven shikobuchi" means major seven shrines which enshrine "shikobuchi god", which is god of belief (信仰神) native to Ado-gawa River basin, runs Kyoto Prefecture and Shiga Prefecture.
Seven Shikobuchi' means major seven shrines which enshrine 'Shikobuchi gods,' which are the gods of belief native to Ado-gawa River basin, runs Kyoto Prefecture and Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Shikobuchi大文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。godsに訂正しました。(信仰神）削除しました。
sen.e: Seven Shikobuchi' means major seven shrines which enshrine 'Shikobuchi gods,' which are the gods of belief native to Ado-gawa River basin, runs Kyoto Prefecture and Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 7社にはいずれもガワタロウ（河童）伝説が残る。
sen.e: Every seven shrines have the legend of Gawataro (Kappa).
Every shrine of seven has the legend of Gawataro (Kappa, a water sprite).
sen.cmt: Every shrine of sevenに訂正しました。hasに訂正しました。Gawataro (Kappa, a water sprite)説明補足しました。
sen.e: Every shrine of seven has the legend of Gawataro (Kappa, a water sprite).

sen.j: 「しこぶち」は、思子淵、志古渕、信興淵などと表記される。
sen.e: "Shikobuchi" was written as 思子淵、志古渕、信興淵 and so on.
Shikobuchi' was written as 思子淵、志古渕、信興淵, and so on.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。コンマ補足しました。
sen.e: Shikobuchi' was written as 思子淵、志古渕、信興淵, and so on.

tit.j: 久多・志古渕神社 (京都市)

sen.j: 京都府京都市左京区久多中の町鎮座。
sen.e: Kuta Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine is enshrined in Kuta, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kuta Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine is enshrined in Kuta, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kuta Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine is enshrined in Kuta, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 花笠踊は無形文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Hanagasa Odori (Flowered Hat Dance) was designated as intangible cultural properties.
Hanagasa Odori (Flowered Hat Dance) was designated as intangible cultural properties.
Hanagasa Odori (Flowered Hat Dance) was designated as intangible cultural properties.

sen.j: 滋賀県高島市朽木村小川鎮座。
sen.e: Ogawa, Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine is enshrined in Ogawa, Kutsuki-mura, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
Ogawa, Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine is enshrined in Ogawa, Kutsuki-mura, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.
Ogawa, Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine is enshrined in Ogawa, Kutsuki-mura, Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 毎年輪番に宿を決めて集まり、床の間に神軸（「思子淵神社」と書かれている）を掛けてお供えをし、赤飯を炊いて会食する思子淵講があった。
sen.e: This shrine holds shikobuchi-ko that people arrange for a place to stay by turns every year and gather together to hang 神軸 (the character "Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine was written) on tokonoma (alcove in a traditional Japanese room where art or flowers are displayed) and make an offering to it, then cook festive red rice and eat meal together.
sen.cmt: 読み方および意味不明
sen.e: This shrine holds Shikobuchi-ko (Shikobuchi beneficial activities) that people arrange for a place to stay by turns every year and gather together to hang a scroll of the god (the character 'Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine' was written) on tokonoma (alcove in a traditional Japanese room where art or flowers are displayed) and make an offering to it, then cook festive red rice and eat meal together.
sen.cmt: Shikobuchi大文字にしました。「思子淵講」説明補足しました。(Shikobuchi beneficial activities)a scroll of the godとしました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: This shrine holds Shikobuchi-ko (Shikobuchi beneficial activities) that people arrange for a place to stay by turns every year and gather together to hang a scroll of the god (the character 'Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine' was written) on tokonoma (alcove in a traditional Japanese room where art or flowers are displayed) and make an offering to it, then cook festive red rice and eat meal together.

sen.j: 大般若経を有し、いずれも文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: This shrine has Daihannyakyo (Great Perfection of Wisdom Sutra), and all of them are designated as cultural properties.
This shrine has Daihannyakyo (Great Perfection of Wisdom Sutra), and all of them are designated as cultural properties.
This shrine has Daihannyakyo (Great Perfection of Wisdom Sutra), and all of them are designated as cultural properties.

sen.j: 滋賀県大津市葛川坂下町鎮座。
sen.e: Sakashita, Shikobuchi Damimyojin Shrine is enshrined in Katsuragawasakashita-cho, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Sakashita, Shikobuchi Damimyojin Shrine is enshrined in Katsuragawasakashita-cho, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Sakashita, Shikobuchi Damimyojin Shrine is enshrined in Katsuragawasakashita-cho, Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 大岩の上に鎮座する小さな祠に祀られている。
sen.e: Daimyojin is enshrined in a small hokora (a small shrine) on the great stone.
Daimyojin is enshrined in a small hokora (a small shrine) on the great stone.

sen.j: 滋賀県大津市葛川坊村町鎮座。

sen.j: 地主神社の境内社として祀られている。
sen.e: It is enshrined as a shrine in precinct of Jishu-jinja Shrine.
It is enshrined as a shrine in precinct of Jishu-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: It is enshrined as a shrine in precinct of Jishu-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 葛川明王院の創始にまつわる伝承がある。

sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。

sen.j: 向かって右の境内社が信興淵神社。
sen.e: The shrine in precinct on the observers' right is Shikobuchi jinja Shrine.
The shrine in precinct on the observers' right is Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: The shrine in precinct on the observers' right is Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 近年まで、陰暦十月七日が祭日であった。
sen.e: Until recent years, October 7th on the lunar calendar was a feast day.

sen.j: 志子淵神を「筏流しの神様」として祀り、毎年志子淵講が行われる。
sen.e: God of Shikobuchi is enshrined as "God of Ikada-nagashi (floating bound timber downstream) and Shikobuchi Ko is held every year.
The god of Shikobuchi is enshrined as 'the god of Ikada-nagashi (floating bound timber downstream) and Shikobuchi-ko is held every year.
